summary: The concept of "consultation of information" within EU legal and regulatory frameworks pertains to the systematic screening and processing of messages and data. This involves the pragmatic configuration of computerised systems to manage confidential inputs while avoiding overburdening resources. It is essential for ensuring that declassified and downgraded information is accurately handled, preventing misinterpretations. The process invites partners to participate in the sharing of relevant data, such as visa applications and related fees, while reserving the right to restrict access to sensitive materials. The Schengen area exemplifies this collaborative approach, where member states, including Liechtenstein and the Benelux countries, work together to streamline information exchange.
